title: Soulful Japa lecture I Sri Madhu Pandit Dasa I 29.07.2023
speaker: HG Madhu Pandit Dasa

segments.text: Om Agyanati Murandhasya Gyananjana Shalakya Chakshurun Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Namah Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Prishtaya Bhutale Srimati Bhaktivedanta Swami Nithilamane
Namaste Saraswati Deve Guravani Pracharani Nirvishesha Shrunyavadi Paschatya Deshatarani
Jai Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nityananda Shri Advaita Gadhadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravukta Vidya
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Hare Krishna Nama Prabhu Ki Jai

the Supreme Personality of Godhead Krishna

Just like we are tiny consciousness
Our body has got tiny consciousness
Krishna is come down in the Shabdavatara
Just like our body is tiny consciousness
This sound has got infinite consciousness.
Krishna himself manifests as the sound.
The sound that we chant is like the vessel into which Nama Prabhu, who is Krishna himself,
shines all his satya, chitta and ananda shakti into that sound.
Just like one sun in the sky shines sunlight into so many water bodies
Just like one sun in the sky shines sunlight into so many water bodies and forms the sun.
Just like one sun in the sky shines sunlight into so many water bodies and forms the reflection of that sun.
The same way one ever effulgent, eternally sounding Nama of this Supreme Lord
in the spiritual world takes avatara first by shining all his shaktis into the sun.

the sound that we utter. Therefore he's called Shabda Avatara. Krishna can come

For the Lord, there is no difference between his Shakti and himself. There's
no difference between Nama Prabhu's effulgence and Nama Prabhu himself. But
when we are, yet there is a difference.
Nama Shakti's, their function is to purify our heart. What is the meaning of
purifying the heart? Purifying the heart means the heart is contaminated. What is
heart? Heart is consciousness. What is consciousness? Sat Chit-ananda.
Right now our heart is contaminated with asat, achit, niranand.
False sat, false chit, false anand.
That is our present consciousness, each of our consciousness.
What is temporary, we consider as everlasting, sat, asat.
Everywhere we are seeing, things are changing, eternally changing, our body is changing,
yet we think that, we never think that the body dies.
So asat, we consider as sat, I am the body.
And so much of achit, we have forgotten we are eternal, we have eternal relationship with Krishna.
Achit means, I am the body and bodily relationships are mine.
The bodily world is real world.
The world of bodily egos are real world.
Lies, we are living in lies.
Nirananda means no ananda, but we think it is ananda.
All the material sense pleasures, so called material love and intimacy in this world,
Only love, intimacy and pleasure in association with Krishna is satya, is truth.
We have got, our heart is full of false pleasure beliefs,
that this will give me pleasure, that will give me happiness, this will give meâ€¦
Whereas a true pleasure conception is giving pleasure to Krishna,
love of Krishna, the pleasure of love of Krishna,
the pleasure of beauty of Krishna,
We take pleasure in seeing material beauties,
which are maya or just momentary appearances.
So, our heart is full of asat, achit and nirananda.
Thinking that to be satya, chitta and ananda.
Because the soul is never satisfied with asat, achit and nirananda.
The soul's original essence is satya, chitta and ananda.
Therefore the holy name first shines pure satya, chitta and ananda energy.
Just like Surya has got unlimited light and heat.
Similarly, when Krishna descends into our heart,
just as the iron put in the fire becomes red hot,
when nama, Hare Krishna nama goes into our heart,
automatically there is an energy that goes into our heart,
And only when our heart is cleansed of asat, achit and nirananda,
what is the point in shuddha nama coming now to your tongue?
So, first he sends the shaktis.
So, we worship Shakti Avesha Nama,
as I said, Lord is absolute.
There is no difference between His reflection and Him.
there is no distance between Him and His name.
He will immediately manifest on our tongue the shuddha nama,
then our body and senses also become pure.
This is the goal of chanting Hare Krishna Maha Mantra.

of offering love to Krishna. That's called Preeti Japa. Next mala you practice Hrithpurvaka Japa.
There is a tendency for us to mechanically chant. So Hrithpurvaka Japa means heartfully we should
chant. We should do from our heart. That means my whole soul should be involved. Soulfully.
Soul means your spirit is there, your heart is there, your mind is there, your senses are there,
everything is given to the sound incarnation. When Krishna has come before me, everything should be
given to him. My mind should be given, my intelligence should be given, my desiring
capacity should be given, my enjoying, everything that I, my delightful, every delight, everything
should be given to the Nama.
That is called Hrithpurvaka Japa. If you don't practice this there is a tendency that okay I have to
finish my sixteen rounds and then automatically the mind will be, your tongue will be chanting
and you will be mindlessly chanting. Mindlessly, heartlessly, spiritlessly chanting. So our
chanting Hrithpurvaka Japa means should soulfully, heartfully,
mindfully, spiritfully, tonguefully, earfully, then Krishna is very pleased. That means you
are recognizing this sound is everything. This sound is Krishna. Give everything of
yours to this sound. That is a practice of Hrithpurvaka Japa. Next is Aghlada Japa. Chant
In what mood you should chant and hear. God is before you. How much jubilant you should
be. So jubilantly hear. Delightfully chant from your heart and jubilantly hear. These
are not imaginations. Please understand in each bead Krishna is receiving your feelings.
These feelings that you are offering is not for yourself. It is a feeling that Krishna
Japa is a relationship, every bead is a relationship with Nama Avatara.
Then there is Utsaha Japa, Utsaha Japa means any Utsaha, Japa is a work, Japa is not one,
one Seva, Seva after Seva building up 108, 16, now 64 rounds is our target, is our work,
is our task, Japa is a Kriya and Karya, Kriya means individual worship, Karya means build
up of worship, so it's a build up of, so what should be the attitude in which you should
build up, one more I want, one more I want, one more I want, enthusiasm is, when you say
enthusiasm, enthusiasm is always referring to some task.
I have a task to complete, so I enthusiastically chant, one after the other, one after, one
more, one more, one more, one more, one more, one more, one more accomplishment, one more
offering of loving, love to the Nama Prabhu, in that spirit, that kind of a spirit, that
kind of a mind, you give to Nama Prabhu, then Nama Prabhu is very pleased.
Then there is Sambandha Japa, each bead is a Sambandha, is a relationship.
As I said, relationship means feeling, Preethi Japa is a Sambandha Japa, Harlada Japa is a
Sambandha Japa, it is reminding you that every Japa is a relationship, and what is a relationship?
I am the worshipper, the worshipped is the Supreme Lord, in the Nama Avatara, in the process
of worship, chant here and with Bhavanas, chant here with Bhavana, bead after bead, bead after
Then Saranagati Bhavana, chant and hear with total surrender of your heart to the Lord.
I am yours, do what you want with me.
My life, my existence, everything is yours.
I do not belong to me.
In that, remember Krishna is saying, Sarva Dharmaan Paritya Jamam Ekam, Saranam Paritya
Sarva Dharmaan Paritya Jamam Ekam, Saranam Praja.
Yes, that Krishna has come, each tongue has come to receive your surrender.
Chant and hear with Saranagati Bhavana.
Then practice Kripa Apeksha Bhavana, chant 108 beats, your heart should be craving for
Only by Krishna's mercy we can get out of this material world.
Only by Krishna's mercy of Chitta we can come out of this trap that, I am this body.
Only I can, by Krishna's Kripa, Kripa Apexha, so Kripa Apexha for Satyachati, Chittashakti,
Chant and hear with Kripa Apeksha. Apeksha means begging.
Beg for enlightenment. Beg for service.
Beg for rejoining with the Lord back to Godhead.
Beg for attachment to Holy Name.
Beg for addiction to chanting the Holy Name.
Feeling that there is no hope.
I am hopeless without your mercy.
You become recipient of Lord's Ashraya.
When you depend upon His Ashraya.
So the whole 108 beats of chanting and hearing.
Begging shelter of the ocean of Nama.
The infinite, unconditional, loving Nama Prabhu.
You have to practice that humility with which one should chant.
Prabhupada says anybody who chants Hare Krishna with great material satisfaction that everything is wonderful for me.
His quality of Japa is very low.
Nothing is wonderful in this world.
Anything and everything can slip out any moment.
So one should understand the nature of this material world.
Everything I have can go in a second.
And I have full faith that whatever you give, whatever you take is all for my good.
And chant in a humble state of mind as a weak living entity.
And strong only by the mercy of the Nama Prabhu.
Humility is not only before the Lord.
Humility is also about how you relate with other children of Krishna.
Every living entity is part and parcel of Krishna.
Unless we have respectful dealings with other devotees,
unless we have respectful dealings with other devotees,
unless we have respectful dealings with other devotees,
with due respect for every living entity,
the taste of Nama will not come.

Beg forgiveness for not recognizing his love for you.
Either we can serve Maya or we can serve Krishna.
This way we complete our 16 rounds.
So this is the essence of soulful Japa.
And how much you can perfect,
there is no end to it,
how wonderful Japa can be of 16 rounds
as a relationship with Nama Prabhu.
